N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 118.1 - Applicability

State Regulations

This Part shall apply to instructional programs provided
pursuant to subdivision 7 of section
3202
of the

Education Law to persons under 21 years of age who have not received a high
school diploma and who have been incarcerated in a correctional facility
maintained by a county or by the City of New York for 10 or more calendar days
or who, in the judgment of the chief administrative officer of the correctional
facility, can reasonably be expected to be incarcerated for a period of 10 or
more calendar days. Such programs shall be the responsibility of the school
district within which the correctional facility is located. The provisions of
sections
118.2, 118.3
and
118.6
of this Part shall not apply
to a city school district which operates, in accordance with the program
requirements generally applicable to school district programs, an academy or an
alternative high school at such a correctional facility and which elects, pursuant to Education Law, section
3602
(35), to
receive applicable aid pursuant to other provisions of section 3602 of the

Education Law in lieu of any aid provided pursuant to Education Law, section
3602(35). Notes
